unnormalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Health & Family Welfare has issued an advisory concerning the rising cases of dengue fever reported across several states. As of 16/10/2024, hospitals in Delhi-NCR and Kolkata are experiencing a surge in patients displaying symptoms of the mosquito-borne illness. Officials urge the public to take preventative measures, particularly eliminating stagnant water sources to curb mosquito breeding.
normalised: New Delhi: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has issued an advisory concerning the rising cases of dengue fever reported across several states. As of sixteenth October two thousand and twenty four, hospitals in Delhi-N-C-R and Kolkata are experiencing a surge in patients displaying symptoms of the mosquito-borne illness. Officials urge the public to take preventative measures, particularly eliminating stagnant water sources to curb mosquito breeding.

unnormalised: The advisory highlights specific guidelines for healthcare professionals. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Director of Public Health, emphasized the importance of early diagnosis and appropriate clinical management. The use of rapid diagnostic tests is encouraged for suspected cases. Treatment protocols include monitoring platelet counts and managing dehydration with ORS. Patients with severe symptoms, such as hemorrhagic manifestations, require immediate hospitalization.

unnormalised: In response to the increasing number of cases, the Delhi government has launched a comprehensive vector control program. Measures include fogging operations in high-risk areas, public awareness campaigns, and the distribution of mosquito nets. The helpline no. 1075 has been activated to provide information and assistance to the public. Municipal corporations are also imposing fines on residents found with mosquito breeding sites on their premises.

unnormalised: The Ministry reiterated the importance of community participation in preventing the spread of dengue. Symptoms to watch out for include high fever, severe headache, muscle and joint pain, and skin rash. If these symptoms develop, individuals are advised to seek medical attention from a qualified physician (MBBS or MD) without delay. The next press conference on this topic is scheduled for 23/10/2024 at 11:00 AM.
